title: Identifying Safe Reptiles for Food
brief: Learn which reptiles are safe to eat and which to avoid for survival nutrition.
steps: Step 1: Cook all reptiles thoroughly, though they can be eaten raw in emergencies without risk of blood diseases (being cold-blooded).
Step 2: Avoid box turtles completely - they feed on poisonous mushrooms and build up highly toxic poison in their flesh that cooking cannot destroy.
Step 3: Avoid hawksbill turtles found in the Atlantic Ocean due to their poisonous thorax gland.
Step 4: Exercise extreme caution around poisonous snakes, alligators, crocodiles, and large sea turtles.
warnings: Box turtle toxin cannot be destroyed by cooking and can be fatal.
Raw reptile flesh may transmit parasites.
Large reptiles and venomous species pose obvious physical dangers.
